common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup Failure and Slow Boot Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or experiencing slow boot times, often getting stuck on "ensure core dependency." This affects both macOS and Windows. Proposed solutions include updating to the latest version, reinstalling, resolving software conflicts (like OneDrive), and waiting for patches addressing server-side issues and hardware requirements.

related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

### Key Points:

* **Issue:** PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up or doesn't run properly.
* **Platforms Affected:** Windows and macOS
* **Symptoms:**
    * Stuck at "ensure core dependency" stage
    * No systray icon
    * PFD can't make a connection
    * Web page warning that PiecesOS can't start
* **Possible Causes:**
    * Server-side issues
    * Local issues (e.g., OneDrive conflicts, outdated app versions)
* **Solutions:**
    * Update to the latest version of PiecesOS
    * Reinstall PiecesOS
    * Resolve conflicts with OneDrive
    * Close and reopen the app
    * Wait for future updates

### Problems Identified:

* **Server-side issues:** An earlier migration process caused major delays for many users.
* **Local issues:** Conflicting software, outdated versions, and OneDrive conflicts can also lead to problems.
* **Patching:** The team is working on a patch for the Desktop app to prevent the hanging issue in the future.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* **Updates:** The team released several updates to address the server-side issues and improve the app's stability.
* **Reinstalling:** Reinstalling the app can sometimes help resolve local issues.
* **Resolving conflicts:** Users are advised to address any conflicts with OneDrive or other software.
* **Closing and reopening:** Closing and reopening the app can sometimes resolve the hanging issue.
* **Waiting for future updates:** The team is working on further updates to improve the app's performance and fix bugs.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* The server-side issues have been resolved.
* The app is now on version 11.1.2.
* Some users are still experiencing issues, particularly in macOS.
* The team is actively working on further updates and fixes.

### Notes:

* This summary is based on the information provided in the GitHub issue conversation.
* The team is still working on improving the app and resolving any outstanding issues.
* Users are encouraged to report any issues they experience and provide feedback to the team.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Conversation Summary:

### Key Points:

* Issue raised: User experienced difficulties launching pieces-for-developers, likely caused by avx2 issues with the vector library on their CPU (Intel i5-3210M, released 2012) and the installed pieces version 11.1.1
* Problem identified: New pieces library requires AVX2 support which was released after the user's CPU
* Solutions proposed: Pieces staff suggested running a command to confirm CPU information, then released version 11.1.2 with a solution for the avx2 incompatibility.
* Outcome: User confirmed the issue was fixed with version 11.1.2

### Further Notes:

* This conversation demonstrates the importance of communication and collaboration between users and developers in resolving technical problems.
* It also highlights the need for compatibility checks and version management to ensure software functionality across diverse hardware configurations.

related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary: "Problem with making requests to Pieces cloud services"

**Key Points:**

* User (@rohanrathi99) is experiencing issues making requests to Pieces cloud services.
* The problem also affects local models.
* Author (@mark-at-pieces) suspects a firewall or network configuration issue.

**Problems:**

* Outgoing requests from PiecesOS are blocked.
* Local models are not functioning properly.

**Solutions:**

* Author requests user to share logs for `com.pieces.os` and `com.pieces.pfd`.
* Author offers real-time debugging assistance via calendar link.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User has not yet responded with logs or scheduled a debugging session.
* The issue remains unresolved.
